userreviews.userReview: My friend Jack loaned me this after we read "Hound Dog Man" for book club. I thought this one was better written than Hound Dog Man. Gipson reminds me very much of Jesse Stuart with his descriptions of the countryside. I liked the characters in this book; the children seemed childlike, and the grandfather character was also believable. My father would have loved Gipson's descriptions of post hole digging. All in all, a good read.
Great setting and details, would have liked it to been longer I enjoyed it so much
This book was full of too many "tarnations" and "hot-diggitys" for my taste. The ending was horrible.
